intro: Bulbostylis antillana, commonly known as the West Indian bulbostylis, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist soil conditions. Bulbostylis antillana is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat.
